title.rendered: Why The Air Quality of Your Home May be The Most Important Factor in Long-Term Health

content.rendered:
When most people think about pollutants, they generally think about the polluted air outside their homes. However, the indoor air quality of your home can also become contaminated and harm the occupants’ health over time. In this post, you will learn everything you need to know about your indoor air quality and how air duct cleaning near me services can help improve it.

Main Factors That Impact Indoor Air

The air inside your home is affected by a variety of factors due to which you might need air duct cleaning near me. These factors include:

Chemicals: The two most common causes of complaints we get regarding poor indoor air are irritation of the eyes, throat, and nose, and bad odors.

If you are experiencing the same issues, it could be due to the presence of specific chemicals such as your cleaning supplies, detergent, paint, auto supplies, and the list continues. It’s not always practical to leave windows open and your doors open to allow fresh air to come inside. You need to have a proper HVAC system.  

Exposure to these chemicals for an extended time can cause you to suffer from nausea, headache, itchy throat, and watery eyes.

Microscopic contaminants: There might be ultrafine particles in your home’s indoor air, which can cause adverse health effects, like cardiovascular and respiratory diseases.

These particles can form from the burning of fuels (from cooking or fireplace), or they can enter your house from outdoor pollution. 

Radon: Radon is a radioactive gas that’s naturally found in rock and soil in some areas. Exposure to radon can cause several health problems including lung cancer.

Most radon exposure occurs inside workplaces, schools, and homes. The gas becomes trapped inside the buildings and properties after entering through holes and cracks in the foundation.

Mold and fungi: Mold, mildew, fungi, and other bacteria are often the #1 reason why people develop allergies or asthma. If you live in a humid area or your house is damp, you are bound to have a mold problem that can cause all sorts of breathing issues.

Humidity is also an important factor. If humidity is too high in your house, it will lead to mold, dust mites, and even water damage. If too low, it will cause rashes, dry skin, and eye irritation.

Pests: Cockroaches, dust mites, pests, and even mice are common sources of allergens, especially in urban areas. If your house has the same issue, it could be exposing you and your family to the risk of developing asthma or rhinitis.

Restore Your Indoor Air Through Air Duct Cleaning Near Me Services

All of the above-mentioned problems can be solved by working with professionals that provide services like “air duct cleaning near me” and “air duct inspection near me”.

At United Home Services, our certified and trained specialists can clean your HVAC system, ductwork, and chimney to ensure no contaminants are entering your house. If you have a radon problem, we can insulate your house to solve that problem as well.

Don’t wait too long to take action or your health issues can get worse. Call us toll-free at 800-399-4248 or complete our online contact form to get in touch with us today!
